definition: humorous poem/limerick
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poem/CL:首[shou3]/poetry/verse

sentences.english: Doggerel comes from popularized scholar poetry and folk poetry.
sentences.chinese: 打油詩文體源於文人詩歌的俗化和大衆詩歌。

sentences.english: This rhymster has written mainly doggerel .
sentences.chinese: 這個所謂詩作者主要寫打油詩。

sentences.english: Then look in the library or on the Internet to find more limericks.
sentences.chinese: 然後到圖書館或上網查找更多的打油詩。

sentences.english: She wrote serious poetry, but also loved composing limericks .
sentences.chinese: 她寫嚴肅題材的詩歌，但也喜歡創作打油詩。
他把他的這首詩歌叫做打油詩。

sentences.english: Or God will toss off a limerick for your pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 或者上帝爲了使你高興而拋出一首五行打油詩。
後人將這類詩歌稱爲“打油詩”。
這首打油詩沒有標明作者是誰。

definition: nursery rhyme
popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
love poem
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
random thoughts (a literary genre)

tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
to tease/to poke fun at
